name: Hyatt At Olive 8

reviews.text: We stayed a couple nights at the Hyatt at Olive 8 in Seattle while looking at some colleges. I found out later that its not the best area, but we never felt unsafe. In fact, we walked around qauite a bit. There was a lot of shopping and food choices within a short walk. I thought the rooms were very pretty. They beds were comfy, and the sheets felt crisp and clean. The bathroom was pretty standard, but clean and all the amenities we needed. Staff was helpful and friendly. We asked for more towels and they were brought to us within 10 minutes of asking. The pool area was nice, we didnt go in, but walked by and people seemed to be enjoying it. There seemed to be plenty of chairs by the pool, too. We liekd the gym. Felt up-to-date. it was clean, and cool inside. I dont have anything negative to say about the place.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in October 2011. For an extra $20/night we got an over-sized queen, which had a lot of extra space, but nothing useful in it (i.e., a huge entryway, but no furniture or a closet or anything else to do with it; a standard sized bathroom; a lot of empty space by the corner). Everything is nice and new. This is just two doors over from the Grand Hyatt (the Paramount Hotel is in between), two blocks from the Seattle Convention Center. Very nice 24h fitness center. A sort of mini-Starbucks for morning coffee & snacks. My only complaints: first, the LEED certification evidently left the hotel wanting to only include low-wattage lighting, and only desk or floor fixtures (no overhead lighting in the rooms). Overall, there was just not enough light in the room. Brighter (CFL) bulbs would help, so would some overhead lighting. My other complaint, which applies overall to Hyatt: please, get some better toiletries. In the world of business travel and TSA grope-fests, I try to travel without bringing my own shampoo etc. The Hyatt Portico brand is consistent with 2.5 star hotels, and they should do better. Enough whining for one review. This really is a very nice hotel, with some nice touches for their LEED certification. It's not as fancy as the Grand Hyatt, but a tad cheaper to make up for it.
reviews.title: Not quite as nice as Grand Hyatt, but plenty nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location -- Well situated on what I would call the "edge" of downtown but also within walking distance to Pike Street, Nortdrom, etc. We never used our car after giving it to the valet -- we were able to walk everywhere.
reviews.title: Would recommend to a friend!

reviews.text: Facility -- Rooms were very clean and well furnished. The bed was very comfortable. The "green" aspect of the hotel was fun -- we enjoyed having to use our room key to power our lights. Many reviews state that the walls are thin and they are CORRECT -- we could hear converstations in the room next door, as well as housekeeping staff in the hall.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price -- We were able to Priceline our room for only $135 per night which, for a 4 star hotel in downtown Seattle, is an outstanding deal. Parking was expensive (about $41 valet for 24 hours) but not necessarily out of touch with rates around the city. I did not notice an option for self parking at the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautifully located and the spa is grand. Swimming pool, sauna and steam room are a great way to recover from walking the hills of Seattle. The bed is excellent: firm and soft with good pillows. The room is equipped with everything you need and the bathroom provisions in both the room and the spa are first-rate. The desk is friendly, the coffee bar in the lobby is comfortable and, while we didn't try the restaurant, you are so well-located that it is easy to find intriguing options right near by. Prices were remarkably reasonable for the amenities provided. Good job, Hyatt!
reviews.title: The joys of swimming!

reviews.text: My hubby was staying here for a conference. It is close to everything in downtown Seattle. Pike's Place is an easy 10-minute walk, and the light rail is about two blocks away. Our room on the 10th floor was small but comfortable with views of downtown. The bed is soft, with plenty of fluffy pillows. A robe comes with the room. I didn't care for the bathroom amenities, considering they are an LEED building I expected Aveda or better. The blow-dryer is OK, it is one of those that has a collapsible handle, but at least not one of those wall units. I would definitely consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Swanky digs, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It pays to stay in a new hotel. Modern, new furniture. Clean room. Had a very comfortable stay. We liked this place a lot, though wish Internet access in our room hadn't cost extra. it is 2011, after all.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The room did strangely echo, though, especially the bathroom. They used lovely tiles in the bathroom, along with a glass pocket door (which is quite loud to open and close in the middle of the night) and I think that's why the bathroom is quite loud. And all sounds associated with, um, bathroom use tend to carry.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But a very nice place in a good location. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Seattle

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt at olive 8 back in late July 2011. We were supposed to stay two nights leading up to our Alaskan cruise honeymoon. Delta screwed up our whole flight arrangement (never had a good experience with Delta) and we ended up running from gate to gate at our transfers and arriving in Seattle after midnight. Since we did not call to tell them we were going to make it they cancelled our room for the night. HOWEVER, when I called they were already on it. They put my wife and I up at the Hyatt regency around the corner in a big suite at no charge! They asked us to come back to Hyatt at olive 8 the next day with an upgrade over the standard king room we reserved. When we showed up they put us in one of their largest suites at no extra charge! Also, they left us a bottle of champagne on ice, some chocolates, and vouchers for free room service breakfast the next morning (it was delicious)! We were floored. Everything was fantastic. The room was the largest suite we had ever been in, and it was beautiful. Very modern and hi tech! Every person we dealt with at the hotel seemed to know who we were and all about our earlier cancellation. They were all so friendly. To top it off, being the cheap guy I am I noticed they charged me at the non AAA rate I reserved. Being the cheap guy I am I brought it up and hey knocked off an extra 100 bucks instead of the 25 I was expecting. I have never experienced such fantastic service at a hotel! I'm not sure if the hotel reads these reviews, but if they do I'm so sorry for taking so long to write this up. You guys helped our honeymoon be an extremely memorable experience. Thank you so much! We want to travel back to Seattle just to stay at this hotel! (won't be traveling on delta)
reviews.title: I have never written a hotel review before, but Hyatt at olive 8 is amazing I just had to!

reviews.text: We stayed at Olive 8 for just one night but enjoyed every minute we were there! Beautiful hotel, amazing service, and great location!!! Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!!!

reviews.text: The hyatt is a reliable and good hotel from which you can easily wander through the lovely city of Seattle :-)!
reviews.title: Superb and the poooool :-)!

reviews.text: Haven't stayed in a Hyatt for awhile and wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great value and outstanding location!

reviews.text: From Seatac, we took the new Seattle light rail. It was about a 40 minute right from the airport - only $2.75 to downtown. From there, there is about a 3.5 block walk to the hotel. No problem if you're traveling light.
reviews.title: Over Night Get Away

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this fairly new property. Its an ultra modern and comfortable hotel in downtown Seattle. Its slightly off to the side of the main area where the other cluster of downtown hotels are but an excellent area and walking distance from the Airport light rail station if you want to go green to this eco friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The room was very comfortable, modern and well lit. Great bedding and bathroom amenities. The gym is excellent, and you can use the spa including separate mens and womens steam, sauna and showers. Its a great set up.
reviews.title: modern, fun, and close to all in downtown

reviews.text: The hotel is very near Pacific place which is great for food and shopping. There are lots of great restaurants in the area if you want to dine elsewhere. Cafe Ladro is nearby if you want some good seattle local brew.
reviews.title: A good stay

reviews.text: I didnt use the hotel restaurant but found the service to be very good on concierge requests and valet services.
reviews.title: Fabulous! Best stay in years.

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay very much, and would definitely return when I go back to the emerald city.
reviews.title: Love!

description: Seattle Green Hotel. Sleek modern design and environmental responsibility converge seamlessly at Hyatt at Olive 8. Designed to be the first LEED certified hotel in the city, Seattle’s newest hotel represents a new echelon for sustainability in the Pacific Northwest. Boasting an array of innovative energy and water saving features, the hotel offers guests the ability to continue their sustainable lifestyle while traveling. A few blocks outside our glass doors are historic Pike Place Market and Puget Sound. Eco-friendly dining and spa amenities present a resort atmosphere in a vibrant city setting. Exuding the best of the Pacific Northwest spirit, brilliant form is combined with environmental function to create a new definition of luxury in downtown Seattle.
